author: Kate Sullivan, Eric Martin
description: President Donald Trump said he would host the leaders of Armenia and Azerbaijan for a peace summit with expectation that the pair will sign an agreement seeking to end decades of conflict between the South Caucasus nations.
title: Trump Says Armenia, Azerbaijan to Sign Peace Deal at White House

author: Greg Stohr
description: The Trump administration asked the US Supreme Court to lift restrictions on a Los Angeles-area immigration crackdown that opponents say relies on racial profiling to decide which people to detain and question.
title: Trump Administration Asks Supreme Court to Lift ICE Racial-Profiling Ban

author: Eamon Farhat
description: The UK confirmed plans to offer discounts on energy bills to people living near new electricity pylons as it seeks to ease opposition to essential grid upgrades.
title: UK to Offer Cheaper Energy Bills to Homes Near Electricity Pylons

author: Alex Vasquez
description: Critics of Mexico’s ruling party are seizing on expensive foreign vacations recently favored by senior leaders as evidence of hypocrisy, which threatens to anger the millions of mostly poor Mexicans who constitute its base of support.
title: Mexico’s ‘Austere’ Ruling Party Hit Over Pricey Vacations Abroad

author: Derek Wallbank, Gregory Korte
description: President Donald Trump signed an order to overhaul the federal grantmaking process, the latest step in his drive to bring more of the government’s outlays under his administration’s control.
title: Trump Signs Order to Tighten His Control Over Federal Grants

author: Gregory Korte
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House reporter Gregory Korte looks at Trump’s new demands from federal data-collectors. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Demands a Recount From America’s Number Crunchers

author: Saleha Mohsin
description: President Donald Trump said he had chosen Council of Economic Advisers Chairman Stephen Miran to serve as a Federal Reserve governor.
title: Trump Names Miran to Fill Seat on Federal Reserve Board

author: Saleha Mohsin
description: White House officials are preparing for President Donald Trump to nominate Council of Economic Advisers Chairman Stephen Miran to serve as a Federal Reserve governor, according to a person familiar with the search.
title: White House Prepares for Trump to Nominate Miran to Fed

author: Anna Edgerton
description: A progressive community organizer who campaigned on affordability is narrowly ahead of business-friendly Seattle Mayor Bruce Harrell in the city’s primary, a result that has echoes of the recent Democratic mayoral race in New York.
title: Seattle Mayoral Race Shows Progressive Shift, Mirroring New York

author: Taylor Mills
description: Further construction of a temporary migrant detention center in the Florida Everglades was temporarily halted by a federal court Thursday after conservation groups said state and federal agencies violated environmental law while quickly building the facility within an ecologically sensitive area.
title: ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ Construction Blocked by Federal Court

author: Isabela Fleischmann
description: California has sued the federal government more than once per week since Donald Trump returned to the White House, showing that the most populous state remains on the front lines of Democratic resistance to the president’s political agenda.
title: California Is Suing US on a Weekly Basis to Hold Trump in Check

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: The Internal Revenue Service won’t adjust current income-tax withholding levels for workers and employers to account for President Donald Trump’s new tax law, delaying savings from retroactive cuts for most taxpayers.
title: IRS Won’t Lower Withholding This Year to Reflect Trump Tax Cuts

author: Wojciech Moskwa
description: Poland’s new President Karol Nawrocki proposed revamping a project to build one of Europe’s biggest airports, rejecting changes to scale down the plan made by the country’s government.
title: Polish President Pressures Premier Over $36 Billion Airport Plan

author: Dan Williams
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said the country’s military plans to occupy all of Gaza in a final push to topple Hamas and end 22 months of fighting.
title: Netanyahu Says Israeli Army Plans Occupation of All of Gaza

author: Jan-Henrik Foerster
description: Karin Keller-Sutter admires the grit of former British Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher and as Swiss president is known as technocratic and tenacious. Those traits look to have backfired when she faced off with Donald Trump and led her country into crisis.
title: Tenacious Swiss Leader Stood Up to Trump — It Backfired on Her

author: Myles Miller
description: Senator John Cornyn said the Federal Bureau of Investigation has agreed to assist Texas authorities in locating Democratic state lawmakers who left the state to block a vote on new congressional maps, potentially intensifying friction between Republican leaders in Texas and Democratic governors.
title: Senator Says FBI Will Help Track Texas Democrats Who Left State

author: Chris Anstey
description: Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers warned that President Donald Trump’s policies risk putting the US on a similar path to that of postwar Argentina, which descended from being a relatively advanced developed nation into an economic laggard.
title: Larry Summers Says Trump Policies Are ‘Scarily’ Like Argentina’s Peron

author: Josh Sisco, John Tozzi
description: Unitedhealth Group Inc. and home health and hospice care company Amedisys Inc. have reached a proposed a settlement with the US Justice Department in a lawsuit that challenged the companies’ $3.3 billion deal.
title: UnitedHealth, Amedisys Reach Tentative Merger Deal With DOJ

author: Erin Hudson, Elizabeth Rembert
description: Few in the US healthcare sector are immune to the effects of Washington’s recent cuts to Medicaid, even the cash-rich teaching hospitals affiliated with top-notch medical schools.
title: Medicaid Cuts Set to Drain Revenue at Elite Teaching Hospitals

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Liam Knox
description: President Donald Trump will sign an executive action requiring colleges and universities receiving federal funding to offer greater admissions data transparency, as the administration ratchets up its efforts to eliminate affirmative action programs.
title: Trump Action to Require More College Admissions Data Reporting

author: Kamran Haider
description: Pakistan’s government has auctioned properties of top real estate tycoon Malik Riaz Hussain after a government agency failed to extradite him from the United Arab Emirates where he lives in self-exile.
title: Pakistan Auctions Properties of Top Real Estate Tycoon

author: Philip Heijmans
description: Cambodia formally nominated President Donald Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize after the US leader threatened to halt trade deals unless the Southeast Asian nation agreed to a ceasefire with Thailand in a recent armed conflict.
title: Cambodia Formally Nominates Donald Trump for the Nobel Prize

author: Sam Dagher, Annmarie Hordern
description: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman plans to meet US President Donald Trump in Washington in November, according to people with knowledge of the preparations.
title: Saudi Arabia Crown Prince MBS to Meet Trump in Washington in November

author: Jim Wyss
description: One of Haiti’s most powerful gang leaders is threatening to attack the prime minister’s office and other branches of government, as the troubled Caribbean nation prepares for a leadership transition.
title: Warlord ‘Barbecue’ Threatens Haiti PM Office as Violence Flares

author: Katherine Doherty, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump plans to sign an executive order Thursday aimed at eliminating practices by banks and their regulators that result in certain customers being denied access to financial services for ideological reasons.
title: Trump to Sign Order Targeting Banks on Political Discrimination

author: Saleha Mohsin
description: Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller is emerging as a top candidate to serve as the central bank’s chair among President Donald Trump’s advisers as they look for a replacement for Jerome Powell, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Waller Emerges as Favorite for Fed Chair Among Trump Team

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Switzerland plans to continue negotiating with the US to lower tariffs from the 39% that kicked in on Thursday and will refrain from implementing countermeasures.
title: Swiss Government Is Still Talking to the US to Lower Tariffs

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent defended President Donald Trump’s firing of the head of the agency that reports US labor data hours after an unexpectedly weak jobs report, saying a revamp was long overdue.
title: Bessent Says Labor Data Clean-Up Should Have Happened Long Ago

author: Swati Gupta, Ruchi Bhatia
description: President Donald Trump’s move to penalize India for buying oil from Russia will increase economic risks for the South Asian nation and test its longstanding ties with Moscow.
title: What’s at Stake as Trump Tests India’s Ties With Russia

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Daniel Carvalho
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is likely to speak with his Brazilian counterpart on Thursday and is expected to head to China for the first time in seven years in August, people familiar with the matter said, coming against the backdrop of worsening ties with the US.
title: Modi to Speak With Lula, Plans Xi Meeting as Ties With US Sour

author: Peter Elstrom
description: President Donald Trump called on the chief executive officer of Intel Corp. to resign because of what he called conflicts of interest, adding to the challenges for a company that is supposed to anchor restoration of the US semiconductor industry.
title: Trump Urges ‘Conflicted’ Intel CEO Tan to Resign Immediately

author: Magan Crane
description: President Donald Trump Wednesday called on his Commerce Department to conduct a new census that excluded undocumented migrants, in a move that could reshape federal spending and elections.
title: Trump Calls for New Census That Blocks Undocumented Migrants from Count

author: Lucy White
description: The UK has detained the first small-boat migrants under a “one in, one out” returns treaty with France, as pressure grows on Prime Minister Keir Starmer to stem the influx of asylum-seekers across the English Channel.
title: UK Detains First Migrants Under Returns Treaty With France

author: Shruti Srivastava, Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Ruchi Bhatia
description: New Delhi officials are weighing their options on trade concessions they can offer to the US after President Donald Trump’s decision to impose a 50% tariff on Indian goods, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: India Weighs Giving Trump Trade Concessions After 50% Tariff Hit

author: Mark Chediak, Jennifer A Dlouhy, Ari Natter
description: President Donald Trump is escalating his attacks on wind and solar power from the rhetorical to the tangible, mounting a rapid-fire campaign that exceeds the industries’ worst fears.In just the past few weeks, the Trump administration instituted permitting reviews that threaten US wind and solar developments.  It imposed standards that would essentially prevent new developments on federal land. It rescinded Biden-era decisions earmarking coastal waters for future wind turbines. And on Wednesday
title: Trump's Latest Attacks Stun Wind and Solar Industries

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Allison McNeely
description: President Donald Trump will sign an executive order Thursday that aims to allow private equity, real estate, cryptocurrency and other alternative assets in 401(k)s, a major victory for industries looking to tap some of the roughly $12.5 trillion held in those retirement accounts.
title: Trump to Sign Order Easing Path for Private Assets in 401(k)s

author: Antony Sguazzin
description: President Cyril Ramaphosa’s biggest burden right now is Donald Trump.
title: South Africa Has Nowhere to Run From Trump

author: Caitlin Reilly, Jarrell Dillard
description: Congressional Republicans are betting bigger tax refunds ahead of midterm elections paid for by cuts in social programs afterward will overcome early public disapproval of President Donald Trump’s signature tax law.
title: GOP Pins Midterm Hopes on Trump Tax Bill’s Front-Loaded Refunds, Delayed Cuts

author: Levin Stamm, Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Swiss politicians across parties are seeking to cancel an order of three dozen F-35A fighter jets from US defense conglomerate Lockheed Martin Corp after President Donald Trump imposed some of the world’s harshest levies on the country.
title: Swiss Politicians Push to Cancel F-35 Fighter-Jet Deal After US Tariffs

author: Ana Monteiro
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa and US President Donald Trump held a phone call Wednesday, a day before Washington’s 30% tariffs on the nation’s goods entering the US kicked in.
title: Trump, Ramaphosa Speak on South Africa-US Trade, Plan More Talks

author: Stacey Vanek Smith
description: Whether they come in the form of higher prices, lower quality or fewer options, tariffs can’t hide forever.
title: It’s Only a Matter of Time Until Americans Pay for Trump’s Tariffs

author: Jamie Tarabay
description: Chinese-owned and operated DJI Technologies is up against an end-of-year deadline to keep its US business alive, and the drone maker is struggling to get anyone in Washington to listen.
title: Chinese Drone Maker DJI Shut Out of Washington With US Market at Risk

author: Jorgelina Do Rosario, Andras Gergely
description: Ukraine’s dollar bonds extended gains after the Kremlin confirmed plans for a meeting between the Russian and US leaders, rekindling bets on a potential truce between Moscow and Kyiv.
title: Ukraine’s Bonds Extend Gains as Kremlin Confirms Summit Plans

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan cut its growth forecast for the current fiscal year as US tariffs and persistent inflation weigh on the economy, complicating the policy course of the Bank of Japan and adding to pressure on embattled Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba.
title: Japan Lowers This Year’s Growth Forecast as Tariffs Kick in

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Presidents Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump will meet for summit talks within the next few days, the Kremlin said Thursday.
title: Russia Says Putin-Trump Meeting to Take Place in Next Few Days

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat, Kok Leong Chan
description: Cambodia and Thailand agreed to uphold a ceasefire, more than one week after a US-backed truce ended the deadliest clashes between the Southeast Asian neighbors in recent history.
title: Cambodia, Thailand Reaffirm Ceasefire Agreement in Border Talks

author: Ruchi Bhatia, Anup Roy
description: US President Donald Trump’s additional tariffs on India will further damage the South Asian nation’s already slowing economy and shrink its gross domestic product by as much as a percentage point, analysts said.
title: Trump’s 50% Tariff May Clip India Growth by 1%, Analysts Say

author: Pratik Parija, Eltaf Najafizada
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi pledged to safeguard the interests of farmers, a day after President Donald Trump doubled tariffs on Indian goods, with pressure mounting on New Delhi to open up its markets to US exports.
title: Modi Vows to Protect Farmers as Trump Builds Tariff Pressure

author: Jana Randow
description: German industrial production suffered its biggest drop in almost a year, raising the prospect that Europe’s largest economy shrank last quarter by even more than initially estimated.
title: German Industry Slumps Most in Almost a Year Amid Trade Flux

author: Vidya N Root, Samy Adghirni
description: France’s thorny relations with Algeria plunged to a new low, as President Emmanuel Macron urged “greater firmness” in its approach and canceled visa exemptions for the North African nation’s officials.
title: French, Algerian Ties Hit New Low After Macron Hardens Stance

author: Helen Nyambura
description: At least 319 people, including dozens of women and children, were killed by the Rwanda-backed M23 rebel group that’s active in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, according to the United Nations agency for human rights.
title: Rwanda-Backed M23 Rebels Killed 319 Civilians in July, UN Says

author: Khine Lin Kyaw
description: Myint Swe, Myanmar’s acting president and a former general sanctioned by the US for his role in a 2021 coup, died at the age of 74 from Parkinson’s disease and related neurological disorders.
title: Myanmar’s US-Sanctioned Figurehead Leader Myint Swe Dies at 74 After Illness

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: One of Donald Trump’s highest tariffs is now in effect on Switzerland after the government failed in its last-ditch effort to get the US president to lower the rate.
title: Developed Nations’ Highest US Tariff Takes Effect on Switzerland

author: Catherine Lucey
description: President Donald Trump’s sweeping new tariffs officially took hold Thursday, as he barrels forward with his turbulent push to reshape global trade.
title: Trump’s Tariffs Take Effect in Fresh Test for Global Economy

author: Jasmina Kuzmanovic, Andrea Dudik
description: The revival of Nazi-era symbolism is dominating the summer tourist season, and some politicians are embracing it.
title: Croatia’s Fascist Past Resurfaces With Far-Right Rock Star

author: Serene Cheong, Rakesh Sharma
description: A US decision to double tariffs on Indian goods as punishment for ongoing purchases of Russian crude leaves the world’s third-largest oil consumer in a tight spot and its refiners in disarray, but the move is unlikely to prompt a radical rethink in New Delhi.
title: Trump’s Punitive India Tariff Spoils Modi’s Russian Oil Math

author: David Voreacos, Liam Knox
description: The Trump administration offered Wednesday to “simplify” its lawsuit with Harvard University over a proposed ban on international student enrollment as both sides face off in a broader dispute involving billions in frozen federal funding.
title: US Offers to ‘Simplify’ Harvard Case Over Foreign Student Ban

author: Colum Murphy
description: President Donald Trump said he could punish China with additional tariffs over its purchases of Russian oil, though one of his top advisers played down the likelihood.
title: Trump Floats Possible Tariffs on China for Buying Russian Oil

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: A fresh discrepancy in interpretations of the US-Japan trade deal came to the fore on Thursday, as Japan’s chief negotiator visits Washington to press for follow-through on a pledge to cut a levy on car imports to 15%.
title: Confusion Over Tariff Stacking Hampers Japan’s Bid to Pin Down US Trade Deal
